items.title: ‘Dream Cities,’ by Wade Graham
items.abstract: The ideas and structures that created today’s cities, and the architects and planners who implemented them.
keywords: Dream Cities: Seven Urban Ideas That Shape the World (Book)

items.title: How a Great City Could Survive Even Rob Ford
items.abstract: The flamboyant mayor may have embarrassed some with his antics, but he was proof of how a city can thrive.

items.title: How to Keep an Atomic Bomb From Being Smuggled Into New York City? Open Every Suitcase With a Screwdriver.
items.abstract: Dan Zak’s “Almighty” is a perfectly measured blend of biography, suspense and history.
keywords: Almighty: Courage, Resistance, and Existential Peril in the Nuclear Age (Book)

items.title: As New York Fights Zika Virus, Officials Turn Their Focus to Sex
items.abstract: Health officials are concerned that the threat of sexual transmission of the virus remains little understood, underpublicized and underestimated.

items.title: Filipino Food Arrives, in a Taco, at 2nd City and Swell Dive
items.abstract: Two New York restaurants attest to the new cachet of an underdog cuisine.

items.title: What’s Coming in New York Real Estate in 2019
items.abstract: An already soft market will get another 20,000 new apartments, making it an even stronger buyer’s and renter’s market.

items.title: City Ballet’s New Season: Here’s What Our Critics Want to See
items.abstract: The company, which has been in flux, programs six world premieres, classics by Balanchine and Robbins, and tributes to Merce Cunningham and Paul Taylor.

items.title: 1 in 5 Bus Riders in New York City Evades the Fare, Far Worse Than Elsewhere
items.abstract: The statistic stunned even the transit system’s leader, who said it was “wholly unacceptable” and at least double the rate of other cities around the world.

items.title: As an Ohio City Struggles, Some See Salvation in a Prairie
items.abstract: A plan to develop a parcel near Dayton International Airport is pitting conservationists against city leaders.

items.title: Textiles Designed With Warp, Woof and Wit at MoMA
items.abstract: The exhibition “Taking a Thread for a Walk” reveals the museum’s underappreciated collection of fiber art and industrial design.
keywords: Taking a Thread for a Walk (Exhibit)

items.title: A Balancing Act for the New City Council Leader
items.abstract: Adrienne Adams has to consider both public safety and some of her members’ determination to overhaul the Police Department.

items.title: N.Y.C. Urges Masks Indoors, but Stops Short of Requiring Them
items.abstract: City health officials urged New Yorkers to wear medical masks indoors and to take other precautions.

items.title: A Mental Health Clinic in School? No, Thanks, Says the School Board
items.abstract: American teenagers are reporting severe levels of anxiety and depression. But when Connecticut moved to expand mental health services in schools, it ran into fierce opposition in one town.

items.title: The Collaborative Studio Reimagining Lighting Design
items.abstract: Known for its endlessly customizable fixtures, In Common With is breaking fresh ground with an expanded Brooklyn headquarters and a fantastical new collection.

items.title: Police Say a Serial Killer Could Be Behind Shootings in Stockton, Calif.
items.abstract: The police said they had connected a series of shootings that have left six dead through ballistics and video footage and said a serial killer could be to blame.
